thread.title_full: Judge calls video of fight allegedly involving ex-Rutgers football players 'bizarre' | NJ.com

author: Sue Epstein | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Judge calls video of fight allegedly involving ex-Rutgers football players 'bizarre'
text:
NEW BRUNSWICK â€”A fight, allegedly involving Rutgers students and former football players facing assault charges, which was described by a superior court judge as "almost barbaric," was recorded by one of the students the judge revealed Friday afternoon.
Calling the video, allegedly recorded by one of the defendants "bizarre," Superior Court Judge Dennis Nieves made clear he wants all of the defendants brought into his courtroom next month so they can view the recording.
"If the community saw what I saw, they would be outraged," Nieves said during a bail-reduction hearing for one of the former players, Tejay Johnson. "I can't forget this."
What the judge said he can't forget is how one of the ex-football players attacks the victim, who ended up with a broken jaw--"blindsides him," and "he drops to the ground and the others stomp him."
"It's almost barbaric," Nieves said. "The defendants need to see those videos."
The fight, which broke out on Delafield Street in April 2015 over a parking spot, left one victim with a broken jaw, authorities have said.
The judge's comments came as he considered how much to lower the bail for Johnson.
Johnson is the only Rutgers student and ex-football player charged in the three home invasions and the assault that have led to the arrests of 11 people, including a total of eight former football players.
Nieves lowered Johnson's total bail from $625,000 bail to $300,000. Johnson had already posted $100,000 after his first arrest for one of the home invasions and will have to post $200,000 to be released for two more armed robbery charges.
